definition: confused/rattled/flustered
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
to get panicky/to lose one's head/(coll.) (after 得) unbearably/terribly
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: The family was completely knocked over at the news.
sentences.chinese: 這個消息使全家感到心慌意亂。

sentences.english: I was really jacked up by the bad news.
sentences.chinese: 我被這條壞消息攪得心慌意亂的。

sentences.english: It may, however, rattle the people you're meeting.
sentences.chinese: 但是，它會使你要會見的人心慌意亂。

sentences.english: The graduate assistant left immediately, distraught.
sentences.chinese: 這位研究生助理心慌意亂之中立即離去。

sentences.english: The small boy looked round in panic.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩心慌意亂地四下張望着。

sentences.english: Xiao Ya was upset about her missing friend.
sentences.chinese: 蕭雅因她的朋友失蹤而心慌意亂。

sentences.english: Some interviewees always have butterflies in their stomach in time of an interview.
sentences.chinese: 有些接受面試者總是在面試時心慌意亂。

sullen/to scowl miserably
to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
to shiver
to keep silent
to turn pale with fright (idiom)
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
unusual condition/something odd/strange shape
red in the face/extremely angry
limp/weak
to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
